gsetting.title: Theme Styling
gsetting.subtitle:
This is the same as the light and dark theme options in GNOME Control Center,
except with the "Light" option which is an experimental desktop light theme.

gsetting.title: Legacy GTK3/GTK4 Theme
gsetting.subtitle: This is the theme used by legacy applications that don't use Libadwaita.

gsetting.title: Icon Theme
gsetting.subtitle: This is the icon theme used by your system.

gsetting.title: Cursor Theme
gsetting.subtitle: This is the theme used for your mouse pointer.

gsetting.title: Interface Font
gsetting.subtitle: This is the primary font used by your system.

gsetting.title: Document Font
gsetting.subtitle: Font used for viewing documents.

gsetting.title: Monospace Font
gsetting.subtitle: Font used when all the letters need to be the same size. For example, terminals and text editors.

gsetting.title: Legacy Titlebar Font
gsetting.subtitle: Font used in the titlebar for apps that don't use header bars (old Gtk apps, non-Gtk apps).

gsetting.title: Font Hinting
gsetting.subtitle: Adjusts font so that it lines up with a rasterized grid.

gsetting.title: Font Antialiasing
gsetting.subtitle: The method of antialiasing used.

gsetting.title: Font Scaling Factor (Percent)
gsetting.subtitle: The scaling factor for font sizes.

gsetting.title: Allow Audio Volume Above 100%
gsetting.subtitle:
This allows you to go above 100% volume in the top bar.
WARNING: this may have an impact on audio quality, and potentially could damage your audio hardware.

gsetting.title: Show Battery Percentage
gsetting.subtitle: This shows the battery percentage in the top bar. This is only useful if you have a laptop.

gsetting.title: Attach Modal Dialogs
gsetting.subtitle: Attaches a window's modal dialogs to itself. Disabling this allows you to move some dialogs separately from the parent window.

gsetting.title: Center New Windows
gsetting.subtitle: Whether or not to start new windows in the center of the screen.

gsetting.title: Window Action Key
gsetting.subtitle: Holding this essentially key treats the whole window like the titlebar.

options: Windows are focused when they are clicked.
Window is focused when hovered with the pointer. Windows remain focused when the desktop is hovered.
Window is focused when hovered with the pointer. Hovering the desktop removes focus from the previous window.

gsetting.title: Titlebar Button Layout
gsetting.subtitle: This is the layout of the titlebar buttons.

gsetting.title: Middle Click Paste
gsetting.subtitle: Whether or not to paste when you middle click.

gsetting.title: Touchpad Acceleration
gsetting.subtitle:
Turning acceleration off can allow faster and more precise movements,
but can also make the touchpad more difficult to use.

gsetting.title: Pointing Stick Acceleration
gsetting.subtitle:
Turning acceleration off can allow faster and more precise movements,
but can also make the pointing stick more difficult to use.

gsetting.title: Show Extended Sources in Settings
gsetting.subtitle: Show extended input sources in GNOME Control Center's Keyboard settings.

gsetting.title: Enable Third Party Extensions
gsetting.subtitle: Third party extensions are not supported by stillOS and may cause unforeseen issues. stillOS modifies GNOME Shell, so not every extension will work properly.

gsetting.title: Show System Extensions (Advanced)
gsetting.subtitle:
ONLY DO THIS IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!!

These extensions are used by stillOS's UI. Disabling them or changing settings may cause problems.
